skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...

security_audit.summary: Official skill source with predefined templates and guidance. Minimal audit completed with no security findings or unsafe behaviors observed.

content.value_statement: Internal updates often lack a clear format and waste time. This skill provides proven templates for newsletters, 3P updates, and FAQs.
actual_capabilities: Produce 3P updates with emoji, team name, and strict Progress, Plans, Problems sections
Draft company newsletters with sections and concise bullet points
Generate FAQ question and answer pairs using a consistent format
Ask for audience, purpose, tone, and formatting for general comms
Guide content gathering from Slack, email, documents, and calendar
limitations: Does not access Slack, email, or documents without user provided content
Requires team name and time period for 3P updates
Does not verify facts or metrics
Newsletter guidance assumes company wide scope

use_cases.title: Weekly 3P update
use_cases.description: Turn team notes into a concise Progress, Plans, Problems update for leadership.

use_cases.title: Company newsletter
use_cases.description: Summarize major announcements into a readable newsletter for all employees.

use_cases.title: FAQ roundup
use_cases.description: Create clear questions and answers from common employee concerns.

prompt_templates.title: Create a 3P update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for the Mobile team covering Aug 1 to Aug 7. Progress: shipped v2 onboarding. Plans: fix crash bug, start A B test. Problems: blocked on API from Core team.

prompt_templates.title: Draft a newsletter
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a company newsletter with sections for announcements, progress, and social updates. Use 15 to 20 bullets and include placeholder links.

prompt_templates.title: Answer top FAQs
prompt_templates.prompt: Write five FAQs about the new performance review process. Keep each answer to two sentences and note if an answer needs HR approval.

prompt_templates.title: General comms request
prompt_templates.prompt: Ask me for audience, purpose, tone, and format, then draft a short internal note about a planned system maintenance window.

output_examples.input: Write a 3P update for the Data Platform team for last week.
output: Progress: Delivered the new ingestion pipeline with 2x throughput and migrated three services.
Plans: Expand monitoring coverage and complete backfill for legacy datasets.
Problems: Waiting on security review for production credentials.

best_practices: Provide team name and dates for 3P updates
Share source notes or links to company announcements
Keep bullet points short and data driven
anti_patterns: Using informal tone for leadership updates
Including team specific details in company newsletters
Writing long paragraphs instead of bullets

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it uses plain text templates and works across those platforms.

faq.question: What are the content limits?
faq.answer: It follows concise formats, such as short 3P sections and newsletter bullets.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Slack or Google Drive?
faq.answer: It can reference those sources, but you must provide the content.

faq.question: Does it store or share company data?
faq.answer: No, it only uses the information you provide in the prompt.

faq.question: What if the format does not fit my needs?
faq.answer: It asks for audience, purpose, tone, and format to adapt the draft.

faq.question: How does it compare to a generic writing prompt?
faq.answer: It applies strict internal formats for newsletters, 3P updates, and FAQs.
